TypeSignature.Value: public struct DateTime : IComparable, IComparable<DateTime>, IConvertible, IEquatable<DateTime>, IFormattable, System.Runtime.Serialization.ISerializable

.class public auto ansi serializable sealed beforefieldinit DateTime extends System.ValueType implements class System.IComparable, class System.IComparable`1<valuetype System.DateTime>, class System.IConvertible, class System.IEquatable`1<valuetype System.DateTime>, class System.IFormattable, class System.Runtime.Serialization.ISerializable
Public Structure DateTime Implements IComparable, IComparable(Of DateTime), IConvertible, IEquatable(Of DateTime), IFormattable, ISerializable
public value class DateTime : IComparable, IComparable<DateTime>, IConvertible, IEquatable<DateTime>, IFormattable, System::Runtime::Serialization::ISerializable

summary.span: 表示時間的瞬間，通常以一天的日期和時間表示。

span.span: Represents an instant in time, typically expressed as a date and time of day.

remarks.format: ## 範例程式碼的快速連結Quick links to example code [!INCLUDE[interactive-note](~/includes/csharp-interactive-note.md)] 本文包含數個範例使用`DateTime`類型：This article includes several examples that use the `DateTime` type: **初始化範例** **Initialization Examples** [叫用建構函式](#initialization-01) [Invoke a constructor](#initialization-01) [叫用隱含的預設建構函式](#initialization-02) [Invoke the implicit default constructor](#initialization-02) [傳回值的指派](#initialization-03) [Assignment from return value](#initialization-03) [剖析字串，表示日期和時間](#initialization-04) [Parsing a string that represents a date and time](#initialization-04) [Visual Basic 語法，來初始化日期和時間Visual Basic syntax to initialize a date and time](#initialization-05) **格式化`DateTime`物件做為字串****Formatting `DateTime` objects as strings** [使用預設的日期時間格式](#formatting-01) [Use the default date time format](#formatting-01) [格式化的日期和時間使用特定文化特性](#formatting-02) [Format a date and time using a specific culture](#formatting-02) [使用標準或自訂格式字串的日期時間格式](#formatting-03) [Format a date time using a standard or custom format string](#formatting-03) [指定格式字串和特定文化特性](#formatting-04) [Specify both a format string and a specific culture](#formatting-04) [使用 ISO 8601 標準 web 服務的日期時間格式Format a date time using the ISO 8601 standard for web services](#formatting-05) **剖析字串做為`DateTime`物件****Parsing strings as `DateTime` objects** [使用`Parse`或`TryParse`將字串轉換成日期和時間](#parsing-01) [Use `Parse` or `TryParse` to convert a string to a date and time](#parsing-01) [使用`ParseExact`或`TryParseExact`中已知的格式字串轉換](#parsing-02) [Use `ParseExact` or `TryParseExact` to convert a string in a known format](#parsing-02) [將 ISO 8601 字串表示轉換為日期和時間Convert from the ISO 8601 string representation to a date and time](#parsing-03) **`DateTime` 解決方式****`DateTime` resolution** [瀏覽的日期和時間值的解析度](#resolution-01) [Explore the resolution of date and time values](#resolution-01) [在容許範圍內的相等比較Comparing for equality within a tolerance](#comparison-01) **文化特性和行事曆****Culture and calendars** [顯示使用的文化特性特定的行事曆的日期和時間值](#calendars-01) [Display date and time values using culture specific calendars](#calendars-01) [剖析字串，根據文化特性特定行事曆](#calendars-02) [Parse strings according to a culture specific calendar](#calendars-02) [初始化的日期和時間的特定文化特性的曆法](#calendars-03) [Initialize a date and time from a specific culture's calendar](#calendars-03) [存取使用特定文化特性的曆法的日期和時間屬性](#calendars-04) [Accessing date and time properties using a specific culture's calendar](#calendars-04) [擷取使用文化特性特定的行事曆的年度週次Retrieving the week of the year using culture specific calendars](#calendars-05) **持續性****Persistence** [保存的日期和時間值以本地時區的字串](#persistence-01) [Persisting date and time values as strings in the local time zone](#persistence-01) [文化特性和時間的非變異格式字串的形式保存的日期和時間值](#persistence-02) [Persisting date and time values as strings in a culture and time invariant format](#persistence-02) [保存的日期和時間值做為整數](#persistence-03) [Persisting date and time values as integers](#persistence-03) [使用保存的日期和時間值 `XmlSerializer`](#persistence-04) [Persisting date and time values using the `XmlSerializer`](#persistence-04) [使用保存的日期和時間值 `BinaryFormatter`](#persistence-05) [Persisting date and time values using the `BinaryFormatter`](#persistence-05) [保存的日期和時間值的時區資料Persisting date and time values with time zone data](#persistence-06) ## 快速連結至 < 備註 > 主題。Quick links to Remarks topics. 此章節包含許多常見的用法`DateTime`結構：This section contains topics for many common uses of the `DateTime` struct: [初始化`DateTime`物件](#initializing-a-datetime-object) [Initializing a `DateTime` object](#initializing-a-datetime-object) [日期時間值和其字串表示法](#datetime-values-and-their-string-representations) [DateTime values and their string representations](#datetime-values-and-their-string-representations) [從字串剖析日期時間值](#parsing-datetime-values-from-strings) [Parsing DateTime values from strings](#parsing-datetime-values-from-strings) [日期時間值](#datetime-values) [DateTime values](#datetime-values) [DateTime 作業](#datetime-operations) [DateTime operations](#datetime-operations) [日期時間解析](#datetime-resolution) [DateTime resolution](#datetime-resolution) [日期時間值和行事曆](#datetime-values-and-calendars) [DateTime values and calendars](#datetime-values-and-calendars) [保存的日期時間值](#persisting-datetime-values) [Persisting DateTime values](#persisting-datetime-values) [DateTime vs。TimeSpan](#datetime-vs-timespan) [DateTime vs. TimeSpan](#datetime-vs-timespan) [是否在容許範圍內的相等比較](#comparing-for-equality-within-tolerance) [COM interop 的考量](#com-interop-considerations)[Comparing for equality within tolerance](#comparing-for-equality-within-tolerance) [COM interop considerations](#com-interop-considerations) 實值類型代表日期和時間值範圍介於 00:00:00 （午夜），年 1 月 1 日 0001 如下 （一般紀元） 到 11:59:59 P.M.年 12 月 31 到西元 9999年日The value type represents dates and times with values ranging from 00:00:00 (midnight), January 1, 0001 Anno Domini (Common Era) through 11:59:59 P.M., December 31, 9999 A.D. (C.E.)西曆。(C.E.) in the Gregorian calendar. 時間值會以稱為刻度的 100 奈秒為單位測量。Time values are measured in 100-nanosecond units called ticks. 在特定日期是西元 1 日 0001年 12:00 午夜起的刻度數A particular date is the number of ticks since 12:00 midnight, January 1, 0001 A.D. (C.E.)在行事曆。(C.E.) in the calendar. 數字會排除會加入閏秒的刻度。The number excludes ticks that would be added by leap seconds. 例如，31241376000000000l 刻度值代表日期 0100 年 1 月 01，星期五午夜 12:00:00。For example, a ticks value of 31241376000000000L represents the date Friday, January 01, 0100 12:00:00 midnight. A值一律表示在內容明確或預設的行事曆。A value is always expressed in the context of an explicit or default calendar. > [!NOTE] > 如果您正在使用刻度值，您要轉換成某些其他時間間隔，例如分鐘或秒鐘，您應該使用， ， ， ，或常數，以執行轉換。If you are working with a ticks value that you want to convert to some other time interval, such as minutes or seconds, you should use the , , , , or constant to perform the conversion. 例如，若要加入的秒數表示所指定的刻度數元件值，您可以使用運算式`dateValue.Second + nTicks/Timespan.TicksPerSecond`。For example, to add the number of seconds represented by a specified number of ticks to the component of a value, you can use the expression `dateValue.Second + nTicks/Timespan.TicksPerSecond`. 您可以檢視完整的範例，在此文件的來源在[Visual Basic](https://github.com/dotnet/samples/tree/master/snippets/visualbasic/System.DateTime/)或[C#](https://github.com/dotnet/samples/tree/master/snippets/csharp/System.DateTime/)從 GitHub 上的文件儲存機制。You can view the source for the entire set of examples from this article in either [Visual Basic](https://github.com/dotnet/samples/tree/master/snippets/visualbasic/System.DateTime/) or [C#](https://github.com/dotnet/samples/tree/master/snippets/csharp/System.DateTime/) from the docs repository on GitHub. > [!NOTE] > 替代結構處理日期和時間值特別時區是結構。An alternative to the structure for working with date and time values in particular time zones is the structure. 結構會將日期和時間資訊儲存在私用欄位，依據該日期和時間的分鐘數與 UTC 差異大小的私用欄位。The structure stores date and time information in a private field and the number of minutes by which that date and time differs from UTC in a private field. 這可讓值，以反映為特定時區的時間，而只 UTC 和本機時區的時間，可以明確地反映值。This makes it possible for a value to reflect the time in a particular time zone, whereas a value can unambiguously reflect only UTC and the local time zone's time. 如需有關使用時機的討論結構或結構處理日期和時間值時，請參閱[選擇之間 DateTime、 DateTimeOffset、 TimeSpan 和 TimeZoneInfo](~/docs/standard/datetime/choosing-between-datetime.md)。For a discussion about when to use the structure or the structure when working with date and time values, see [Choosing Between DateTime, DateTimeOffset, TimeSpan, and TimeZoneInfo](~/docs/standard/datetime/choosing-between-datetime.md). ### 初始化為 DateTime 物件Initializing a DateTime object 您可以將初始值指派給新`DateTime`許多不同的方式中的值：You can assign an initial value to a new `DateTime` value in many different ways: - 呼叫建構函式，讓您指定引數的值，其中一個，或使用隱含的預設建構函式。Calling a constructor, either one where you specify arguments for values, or use the implicit default constructor. - 指派`DateTime`屬性或方法的傳回值。Assigning a `DateTime` to the return value of a property or method. - 剖析`DateTime`從物件的字串表示的值。Parsing a `DateTime` value from its string representation. - 使用 Visual Basic 特定的語言功能來具現化`DateTime`。Using Visual Basic specific language features to instantiate a `DateTime`. 下列程式碼片段會顯示每個範例：The following code snippets show examples of each: #### 叫用建構函式Invoke Constructors 您呼叫任何的多載建構函式會指定日期和時間值 （例如年、 月和日或刻度數目） 的項目。You call any of the overloads of the constructor that specify elements of the date and time value (such as the year, month, and day, or the number of ticks). 下列程式碼會建立特定的日期使用指定年、 月、 日、 小時、 分鐘和第二個建構函式。The following code creates a specific date using the constructor specifying the year, month, day, hour, minute, and second. [!code-vb[System.DateTime.Instantiation#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/System.DateTime/Instantiation.vb#1)][!code-vb[System.DateTime.Instantiation#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/System.DateTime/Instantiation.vb#1)] [!code-csharp-interactive[System.DateTime.Instantiation#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/System.DateTime/Instantiation.cs#1)] 您可以叫用`DateTime`結構的隱含預設建構函式時要`DateTime`初始化為其預設值。You invoke the `DateTime` structure's implicit default constructor when you want a `DateTime` initialized to its default value. (如實值類型的隱含的預設建構函式的詳細資訊，請參閱[實值型別](~/docs/csharp/language-reference/keywords/value-types.md)。)某些編譯器也支援宣告之前明確指派值給它的值。(For details on the implicit default constructor of a value type, see [Value Types](~/docs/csharp/language-reference/keywords/value-types.md).) Some compilers also support declaring a value without explicitly assigning a value to it. 建立不使用明確的初始設定值，也會導致預設值。Creating a value without an explicit initialization also results in the default value. 下列範例說明隱含的預設建構函式，在 C# 和 Visual Basic 中，以及宣告未在 Visual Basic 中的指派。The following example illustrates the implicit default constructor in C# and Visual Basic, as well as a declaration without assignment in Visual Basic. [!code-vb[System.DateTime.Instantiation#5](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/System.DateTime/Instantiation.vb#5)][!code-vb[System.DateTime.Instantiation#5](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/System.DateTime/Instantiation.vb#5)] [!code-csharp-interactive[System.DateTime.Instantiation#5](~/samples/snippets/csharp/System.DateTime/Instantiation.cs#5)] #### 指定計算的值Assigning a computed value 您可以指派物件屬性或方法傳回的日期和時間值。You can assign the object a date and time value returned by a property or method. 下列範例會指派目前的日期和時間、 目前的國際標準時間 (UTC) 日期和時間，以及目前的日期到三個新變數。The following example assigns the current date and time, the current Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) date and time, and the current date to three new variables. [!code-vb[System.DateTime.Instantiation#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/System.DateTime/Instantiation.vb#3)][!code-vb[System.DateTime.Instantiation#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/System.DateTime/Instantiation.vb#3)] [!code-csharp[System.DateTime.Instantiation#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/System.DateTime/Instantiation.cs#3)] #### 剖析字串，表示為 DateTimeParsing a string that represents a DateTime ， ， ，和方法全都會將字串轉換為其相等的日期和時間值。The , , , and methods all convert a string to its equivalent date and time value. 下列範例會使用和方法來剖析字串，並將它轉換成值。The following examples use the and methods to parse a string and convert it to a value. 第二種格式會使用支援的形式[ISO 8601](https://www.iso.org/iso-8601-date-and-time-format.html)標準表示的日期和時間格式字串。The second format uses a form supported by the [ISO 8601](https://www.iso.org/iso-8601-date-and-time-format.html) standard for a representing date and time in string format. 此標準的表示法通常用來傳送 web 服務中的日期資訊。This standard representation is often used to transfer date information in web services. [!code-vb[System.DateTime.Instantiation#4](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/System.DateTime/Instantiation.vb#4)][!code-vb[System.DateTime.Instantiation#4](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/System.DateTime/Instantiation.vb#4)] [!code-csharp[System.DateTime.Instantiation#4](~/samples/snippets/csharp/System.DateTime/Instantiation.cs#4)] 和方法指出字串是否有效表示法值，而且如果是，會執行轉換。The and methods indicate whether a string is a valid representation of a value and, if it is, performs the conversion. #### Visual basic 中的特定語言的語法Language-specific syntax for Visual Basic 下列 Visual Basic 陳述式初始化新值。The following Visual Basic statement initializes a new value. [!code-vb[System.DateTime.Instantiation#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/System.DateTime/Instantiation.vb#2)][!code-vb[System.DateTime.Instantiation#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/System.DateTime/Instantiation.vb#2)] ### 日期時間值和其字串表示法DateTime values and their string representations 就內部而言，所有值會表示為 0001 年 1 月 1 日的 12:00:00 午夜以來已經過的刻度 （100 奈秒間隔數） 數目。Internally, all values are represented as the number of ticks (the number of 100-nanosecond intervals) that have elapsed since 12:00:00 midnight, January 1, 0001. 實際值無關的方式顯示時，出現的值。The actual value is independent of the way in which that value appears when displayed. 外觀值是將值轉換為其字串表示的格式設定作業的結果。The appearance of a value is the result of a formatting operation that converts a value to its string representation. 日期和時間值的外觀會相依於文化特性、 國際標準、 應用程式需求和個人的喜好設定。The appearance of date and time values is dependent on culture, international standards, application requirements, and personal preference. 結構，可提供彈性格式化日期和時間值的多載透過。The structure offers flexibility in formatting date and time values through overloads of . 預設值方法會傳回使用目前文化特性的簡短日期和完整時間模式的日期和時間值的字串表示。The default method returns the string representation of a date and time value using the current culture's short date and long time pattern. 下列範例會使用預設方法。The following example uses the default method. 它會顯示的日期和時間使用目前的文化特性的簡短日期和完整時間模式。It displays the date and time using the short date and long time pattern for the current culture. EN-US 文化特性是在此範例執行所在電腦上目前的文化特性。The en-US culture is the current culture on the computer on which the example was run. [!code-csharp-interactive[System.DateTime.Formatting#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/System.DateTime/StringFormat.cs#1)][!code-csharp-interactive[System.DateTime.Formatting#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/System.DateTime/StringFormat.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.DateTime.Formatting#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/System.DateTime/StringFormat.vb#1)] 您可能需要格式化特定文化特性中支援，伺服器可能在不同的文化特性，從用戶端的 web 案例的日期。You may need to format dates in a specific culture to support web scenarios where the server may be in a different culture from the client. 您指定的文化特性使用方法，建立特定的文化特性的簡短日期和完整時間表示。You specify the culture using the method to create the short date and long time representation in a specific culture. 下列範例會使用方法來顯示日期和時間使用 FR-FR 文化特性的簡短日期和完整時間模式。The following example uses the method to display the date and time using the short date and long time pattern for the fr-FR culture. [!code-csharp-interactive[System.DateTime.Formatting#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/System.DateTime/StringFormat.cs#2)][!code-csharp-interactive[System.DateTime.Formatting#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/System.DateTime/StringFormat.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.DateTime.Formatting#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/System.DateTime/StringFormat.vb#2)] 其他應用程式可能需要不同的字串表示的日期。Other applications may require different string representations of a date. 方法會傳回使用目前文化特性的格式化慣例的標準或自訂格式規範所定義的字串表示。The method returns the string representation defined by a standard or custom format specifier using the formatting conventions of the current culture. 下列範例會使用方法，以顯示完整日期和時間模式的 EN-US 文化特性，在此範例執行所在電腦上目前的文化特性。The following example uses the method to display the full date and time pattern for the en-US culture, the current culture on the computer on which the example was run. [!code-csharp-interactive[System.DateTime.Formatting#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/System.DateTime/StringFormat.cs#3)][!code-csharp-interactive[System.DateTime.Formatting#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/System.DateTime/StringFormat.cs#3)] [!code-vb[System.DateTime.Formatting#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/System.DateTime/StringFormat.vb#3)] 最後，您可以指定文化特性及格式使用方法。Finally, you can specify both the culture and the format using the method. 下列範例會使用方法，以顯示完整日期和時間模式的 FR-FR 文化特性。The following example uses the method to display the full date and time pattern for the fr-FR culture. [!code-csharp-interactive[System.DateTime.Formatting#4](~/samples/snippets/csharp/System.DateTime/StringFormat.cs#4)][!code-csharp-interactive[System.DateTime.Formatting#4](~/samples/snippets/csharp/System.DateTime/StringFormat.cs#4)] [!code-vb[System.DateTime.Formatting#4](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/System.DateTime/StringFormat.vb#4)] 多載也可用以自訂格式字串來指定其他格式。The overload can also be used with a custom format string to specify other formats. 下列範例示範如何格式化字串，使用[ISO 8601](https://www.iso.org/iso-8601-date-and-time-format.html)通常用於 web 服務的標準格式。The following example shows how to format a string using the [ISO 8601](https://www.iso.org/iso-8601-date-and-time-format.html) standard format often used for web services. Iso 8601 格式沒有對應的標準格式字串。The Iso 8601 format does not have a corresponding standard format string. [!code-csharp-interactive[System.DateTime.Formatting#5](~/samples/snippets/csharp/System.DateTime/StringFormat.cs#5)][!code-csharp-interactive[System.DateTime.Formatting#5](~/samples/snippets/csharp/System.DateTime/StringFormat.cs#5)] [!code-vb[System.DateTime.Formatting#5](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/System.DateTime/StringFormat.vb#5)] 如需有關格式值，請參閱[標準日期和時間格式字串](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-date-and-time-format-strings.md)和[自訂日期和時間格式字串](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-date-and-time-format-strings.md)。For more information about formatting values, see [Standard Date and Time Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-date-and-time-format-strings.md) and [Custom Date and Time Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-date-and-time-format-strings.md). ### 從字串剖析日期時間值Parsing DateTime values from strings 剖析的字串表示轉換的日期和時間值。Parsing converts the string representation of a date and time to a value. 一般而言，日期和時間字串的應用程式中都有兩個不同的使用方式：Typically, date and time strings have two different usages in applications: - 日期和時間會有各種形式，都會反映目前文化特性或特定文化特性的慣例。A date and time takes a variety of forms and reflects the conventions of either the current culture or a specific culture. 例如，應用程式可讓其目前的文化特性是 EN-US 輸入日期值為"12/15/2013"或"2013 年 12 月 15 日 」 的使用者。For example, an application allows a user whose current culture is en-US to input a date value as "12/15/2013" or "December 15, 2013". 它可讓的使用者，其目前的文化特性是 en-us gb 到輸入日期值做為 「 15/12/2013 」 或 「 15 2013 年 12 月 」。It allows a user whose current culture is en-gb to input a date value as "15/12/2013" or "15 December 2013." - 預先定義的格式表示的日期和時間。A date and time is represented in a predefined format. 例如，應用程式將序列化"20130103"獨立應用程式執行所在的文化特性的日期。For example, an application serializes a date as "20130103" independently of the culture on which the app is running. 應用程式可能需要在目前文化特性的簡短日期格式輸入日期。An application may require dates be input in the current culture's short date format. 您使用或方法，將字串轉換的文化特性所使用的一般日期和時間格式的其中一個值。You use the or method to convert a string from one of the common date and time formats used by a culture to a value. 下列範例示範如何使用轉換至不同的特定文化特性的格式的日期字串值。The following example shows how you can use to convert date strings in different culture-specific formats to a value. 目前的文化特性變更為 英文 （英國） 以及呼叫方法來產生日期和時間字串的陣列。It changes the current culture to English (Great Britain) and calls the method to generate an array of date and time strings. 接著，將每個項目陣列中要方法。It then passes each element in the array to the method. 範例輸出會顯示剖析方法能夠成功地將每個特定文化特性的日期和時間字串轉換。The output from the example shows the parsing method was able to successfully convert each of the culture-specific date and time strings. time values, see [Parsing Date and Time Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/parsing-datetime.md). ### 日期時間值DateTime values 中的時間值的描述類型通常會使用標準的國際標準時間 (UTC) 來表示。Descriptions of time values in the type are often expressed using the Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) standard. 國際標準時間是國際認可的名稱格林威治標準時間 (GMT)。Coordinated Universal Time is the internationally recognized name for Greenwich Mean Time (GMT). 國際標準時間是在 UTC 原點零度經度測量的時間。Coordinated Universal Time is the time as measured at zero degrees longitude, the UTC origin point. 不適用 UTC 日光節約時間。Daylight saving time is not applicable to UTC. 本地時間為相對於特定的時區。Local time is relative to a particular time zone. 時區是時區位移與相關聯。A time zone is associated with a time zone offset. 時區位移是時區的以 UTC 原點小時為單位位移。A time zone offset is the displacement of the time zone measured in hours from the UTC origin point. 此外，其中加上或減去的時間間隔調整日光節約時間 （選擇性） 會影響本地時間。In addition, local time is optionally affected by daylight saving time, which adds or subtracts a time interval adjustment. 本地時間的計算方式加入 UTC，如有必要，日光節約時間調整的時區位移。Local time is calculated by adding the time zone offset to UTC and adjusting for daylight saving time if necessary. UTC 原點的時區位移為零。The time zone offset at the UTC origin point is zero. UTC 時間為適用於計算、 比較，並儲存日期和時間的檔案。UTC time is suitable for calculations, comparisons, and storing dates and time in files. 本地時間為適當的桌面應用程式的使用者介面中顯示的資料。Local time is appropriate for display in user interfaces of desktop applications. 時區感知應用程式 （例如許多 Web 應用程式） 也需要處理一些其他的時區。Time zone-aware applications (such as many Web applications) also need to work with a number of other time zones. 如果屬性物件是，是未指定表示的時間是否本地時間、 UTC 時間或某些其他時區的時間。If the property of a object is , it is unspecified whether the time represented is local time, UTC time, or a time in some other time zone. ### 日期時間解析DateTime resolution > [!NOTE] > 做為執行日期和時間運算上替代值測量已耗用時間，您可以使用類別。As an alternative to performing date and time arithmetic on values to measure elapsed time, you can use the class. 屬性表示的日期和時間值的第二個一個 10-百萬分之一秒為單位。The property expresses date and time values in units of one ten-millionth of a second. 屬性會傳回千分之一秒的日期和時間值中。The property returns the thousandths of a second in a date and time value. 使用重複的呼叫測量已耗用時間屬性是相依於系統時鐘。Using repeated calls to the property to measure elapsed time is dependent on the system clock. 在 Windows 7 和 Windows 8 的系統上的系統時鐘已的解析度大約 15 毫秒。The system clock on Windows 7 and Windows 8 systems has a resolution of approximately 15 milliseconds. 此解析度會影響短暫間隔低於 100 毫秒。This resolution affects small time intervals less than 100 milliseconds. 下列範例說明目前日期和時間值的相依的性，根據系統時鐘的解析度。The following example illustrates the dependence of current date and time values on the resolution of the system clock. 在範例中，外部迴圈會重複 20 倍，而且內部迴圈是用來延遲外部迴圈。In the example, an outer loop repeats 20 times, and an inner loop serves to delay the outer loop. 如果外部迴圈計數器的值是 10，呼叫方法會導入了 5 毫秒的延遲。If the value of the outer loop counter is 10, a call to the method introduces a five-millisecond delay. 下列範例示範所傳回的毫秒數`DateTime.Now.Milliseconds`屬性變更，只有在呼叫之後。The following example shows the number of milliseconds returned by the `DateTime.Now.Milliseconds` property changes only after the call to . [!code-csharp-interactive[System.DateTime.Resolution#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/System.DateTime/Resolution.cs#1)][!code-csharp-interactive[System.DateTime.Resolution#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/System.DateTime/Resolution.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.DateTime.Resolution#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/System.DateTime/Resolution.vb#1)] ### DateTime 作業DateTime operations 計算使用結構，例如或，不會修改結構的值。A calculation using a structure, such as or , does not modify the value of the structure. 相反地，傳回新的計算結構，其值會計算的結果。Instead, the calculation returns a new structure whose value is the result of the calculation. 時區 （例如 UTC 與本地時間，或是一個時區，另一個之間） 之間的轉換作業會將日光節約時間列入考量，但算術和比較作業不這麼做。Conversion operations between time zones (such as between UTC and local time, or between one time zone and another) take daylight saving time into account, but arithmetic and comparison operations do not. 結構本身提供有限的支援從一個時區轉換。The structure itself offers limited support for converting from one time zone to another. 您可以使用方法來轉換 UTC 到本地時間，或者您可以使用方法從本地時間轉換為 UTC。You can use the method to convert UTC to local time, or you can use the method to convert from local time to UTC. 不過，一組完整的時區轉換方法，可以在類別。However, a full set of time zone conversion methods is available in the class. 您使用這些方法的任何其他時間區域的時間轉換的任何一種全世界的時區時間。You convert the time in any one of the world's time zones to the time in any other time zone using these methods. 計算和比較物件才有意義的物件都代表在相同時區的時間。Calculations and comparisons of objects are meaningful only if the objects represent times in the same time zone. 您可以使用物件以代表區域值的時間，雖然兩種鬆散耦合。You can use a object to represent a value's time zone, although the two are loosely coupled. A物件沒有屬性，可傳回物件，表示該日期和時間值的時區。A object does not have a property that returns an object that represents that date and time value's time zone. 屬性會指出如果`DateTime`代表 UTC，本機時間，或未指定。The property indicates if a `DateTime` represents UTC, local time, or is unspecified. 在時區感知應用程式中，您必須依賴某種外部機制來判斷所在時區建立物件。In a time zone-aware application, you must rely on some external mechanism to determine the time zone in which a object was created. 您可以使用包裝兩者的結構值和物件，代表值的時區。You could use a structure that wraps both the value and the object that represents the value's time zone. 如需詳細資訊，在計算和比較中使用 UTC值，請參閱[使用日期和時間執行算術運算](~/docs/standard/datetime/performing-arithmetic-operations.md)。For details on using UTC in calculations and comparisons with values, see [Performing Arithmetic Operations with Dates and Times](~/docs/standard/datetime/performing-arithmetic-operations.md). 每個成員以隱含方式來執行其作業使用西曆。Each member implicitly uses the Gregorian calendar to perform its operation. 例外狀況都是隱含地指定行事曆的方法。Exceptions are methods that implicitly specify a calendar. 其中包括建構函式指定行事曆，以及方法的參數衍生自，例如。These include constructors that specify a calendar, and methods with a parameter derived from , such as . 作業的成員類型納入帳戶詳細資料，例如潤年和月中的天數。Operations by members of the type take into account details such as leap years and the number of days in a month. ## 日期時間值和行事曆DateTime values and calendars .NET Framework 類別庫包含數個行事曆類別，全部都是衍生自類別。The .NET Framework Class Library includes a number of calendar classes, all of which are derived from the class. 包括：They are: - 您[將它們轉換成字串](#persisting-values-as-strings)，並將保存的字串。You [convert them to strings](#persisting-values-as-strings) and persist the strings. - 您[將它們轉換成 64 位元整數值](#persisting-values-as-integers)(值屬性)，並將保存的整數。You [convert them to 64-bit integer values](#persisting-values-as-integers) (the value of the property) and persist the integers. - 您[序列化 DateTime 值](#serializing-dateTime-values)。You [serialize the DateTime values](#serializing-dateTime-values). - 您[序列化以及時區資訊的日期時間值](#serializing-datetime-and-time-zone-data)。You [serialize the DateTime values along with time zone information](#serializing-datetime-and-time-zone-data). 您必須確保還原的常式值不會遺失資料或您選擇哪一種技術不論發生例外狀況。You must ensure that the routine that restores the values doesn't lose data or throw an exception regardless of which technique you choose. 值應該反覆存取。 values should round-trip. 也就是原始的值與已還原的值應相同。That is, the original value and the restored value should be the same. 如果原始值代表單一時刻，它應該識別的時間還原時相同的時間。And if the original value represents a single instant of time, it should identify the same moment of time when it's restored. #### 保存的值為字串Persisting values as strings 已成功還原值保存為字串，請遵循這些規則：To successfully restore values that are persisted as strings, follow these rules: - 對特定文化特性的格式設定，當您還原形式保存它的字串相同的假設。Make the same assumptions about culture-specific formatting when you restore the string as when you persisted it. 若要確保字串可以還原其目前的文化特性是不同的系統儲存的文化特性的系統上，呼叫多載，以將字串儲存使用的文化特性而異的慣例。To ensure that a string can be restored on a system whose current culture is different from the culture of the system it was saved on, call the overload to save the string by using the conventions of the invariant culture. 呼叫或来使用的文化特性而異的慣例來還原字串多載。Call the or overload to restore the string by using the conventions of the invariant culture. 絕對不要使用， ，或多載，會使用目前執行緒文化特性的慣例。Never use the , , or overloads, which use the conventions of the current thread culture. - 如果日期代表時間的單一時間點，請確定它代表在同一時間，它還原時，甚至在不同時區的時間。If the date represents a single moment of time, ensure that it represents the same moment in time when it's restored, even on a different time zone. 轉換儲存它之前的值為國際標準時間 (UTC)。Convert the value to Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) before saving it. 您也可以序列化的值，以及時區資訊。You can also serialize the value along with time zone information. 如需這種方法的詳細資訊，請參閱[序列化的日期時間和時區資料](#TimeZone)。For more information about this approach, see [Serializing DateTime and time zone data](#TimeZone). 最常見的錯誤進行保存時依賴預設值或目前的文化特性的格式化慣例是以字串形式的值。The most common error made when persisting values as strings is to rely on the formatting conventions of the default or current culture. 如果目前的文化特性不同儲存及還原字串時，會發生問題。Problems arise if the current culture is different when saving and restoring the strings. 下列範例會說明這些問題。The following example illustrates these problems. 它會將儲存五個使用在此案例中是英文 （美國） 的目前文化特性的格式化慣例的日期。It saves five dates using the formatting conventions of the current culture, which in this case is English (United States). 還原使用不同的文化特性，在此案例中是英文 （英國） 的格式設定慣例的日期。It restores the dates using the formatting conventions of a different culture, which in this case is English (Great Britain). 因為不同的兩個文化特性的格式化慣例，無法還原兩個日期，以及剩餘的三個日期的不正確地解譯。Because the formatting conventions of the two cultures are different, two of the dates can't be restored, and the remaining three dates are interpreted incorrectly. 此外，如果原始的日期和時間值代表單一時間的還原時間不正確，因為時區資訊將會遺失。Also, if the original date and time values represent single moments in time, the restored times are incorrect because time zone information is lost. [!code-csharp[System.DateTime.Persistence#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/System.DateTime/Persistence.cs#1)][!code-csharp[System.DateTime.Persistence#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/System.DateTime/Persistence.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.DateTime.Persistence#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/System.DateTime/Persistence.vb#1)] 若要反覆存取值已成功，請遵循下列步驟：To round-trip values successfully, follow these steps: 1. 如果值代表單一分鐘的時間，將它們轉換從本地時間到 UTC 藉由呼叫方法。If the values represent single moments of time, convert them from the local time to UTC by calling the method. 1. 將日期轉換成其字串表示法中，藉由呼叫或多載。Convert the dates to their string representations by calling the or overload. 藉由指定使用的文化特性而異的格式設定慣例為`provider`引數。Use the formatting conventions of the invariant culture by specifying as the `provider` argument. 指定使用"O"或"R"標準格式字串應該反覆存取值。Specify that the value should round-trip by using the "O" or "R" standard format string. 若要還原的保存值不會遺失資料，請遵循下列步驟：To restore the persisted values without data loss, follow these steps: 1. 剖析資料，藉由呼叫或多載。Parse the data by calling the or overload. 指定為`provider`引數，並使用相同的標準格式字串的`format`轉換期間的引數。Specify as the `provider` argument, and use the same standard format string you used for the `format` argument during conversion. 包含值`styles`引數。Include the value in the `styles` argument. 1. 如果值代表在時間中，呼叫的單一時刻方法來轉換本地時間與 utc 之間的已剖析的日期。If the values represent single moments in time, call the method to convert the parsed date from UTC to local time. 下列範例會使用而異的文化特性和"O"標準格式字串，確保儲存和還原的值代表不論系統、 文化特性或來源和目標系統的時區時間在同一時間。The following example uses the invariant culture and the "O" standard format string to ensure that values saved and restored represent the same moment in time regardless of the system, culture, or time zone of the source and target systems. [!code-csharp[System.DateTime.Persistence#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/System.DateTime/Persistence.cs#2)][!code-csharp[System.DateTime.Persistence#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/System.DateTime/Persistence.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.DateTime.Persistence#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/System.DateTime/Persistence.vb#2)] #### 保存的值做為整數Persisting values as integers 您可以保存日期和時間當做值代表微秒刻度數。You can persist a date and time as an value that represents a number of ticks. 在此情況下，您不需要考慮的系統文化特性值會保存，並且上還原。In this case, you don't have to consider the culture of the systems the values are persisted and restored on. 保存為整數的值：To persist a value as an integer: - 如果代表單一時間的值，將它們轉換成 UTC 藉由呼叫方法。If the values represent single moments in time, convert them to UTC by calling the method. - 擷取所表示之刻度數值從其屬性。Retrieve the number of ticks represented by the value from its property. 若要還原已保存為整數的值：To restore a value that has been persisted as an integer: 1. 具現化新物件，並傳遞值設定為建構函式。Instantiate a new object by passing the value to the constructor. 1. 如果值代表單一時間點，將它從轉換 UTC 與本地時間藉由呼叫方法。If the value represents a single moment in time, convert it from UTC to the local time by calling the method. 下列範例會保存陣列值做為在美國太平洋時區系統上的整數。The following example persists an array of values as integers on a system in the U.S. Pacific Time zone. UTC 時區系統上還原它。It restores it on a system in the UTC zone. 包含整數的檔案包含值，指出總數緊接著它的值。The file that contains the integers includes an value that indicates the total number of values that immediately follow it. [!code-csharp[System.DateTime.Persistence#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/System.DateTime/Persistence.cs#3)][!code-csharp[System.DateTime.Persistence#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/System.DateTime/Persistence.cs#3)] [!code-vb[System.DateTime.Persistence#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/System.DateTime/Persistence.vb#3)] #### 序列化的日期時間值Serializing DateTime values 您可以保存值透過序列化到資料流或檔案，然後再還原它們透過還原序列化。You can persist values through serialization to a stream or file, and then restore them through deserialization. 資料會以某些指定的物件格式序列化。 data is serialized in some specified object format. 將物件還原序列化時還原。The objects are restored when they are deserialized. 格式器或序列化程式，例如或，處理的序列化和還原序列化程序。A formatter or serializer, such as or , handles the process of serialization and deserialization. 如需序列化和.NET Framework 所支援的序列化類型的詳細資訊，請參閱[序列化](~/docs/standard/serialization/index.md)。For more information about serialization and the types of serialization supported by the .NET Framework, see [Serialization](~/docs/standard/serialization/index.md). 下列範例會使用類別來序列化和還原序列化值。The following example uses the class to serialize and deserialize values. 值代表所有閏年第二十一世紀的日期。The values represent all leap year days in the twenty-first century. 如果目前文化特性是英文 （英國） 的系統上執行此範例輸出會表示結果。The output represents the result if the example is run on a system whose current culture is English (Great Britain). 因為您已還原序列化物件本身的程式碼不需要處理日期和時間格式的文化特性差異。Because you've deserialized the object itself, the code doesn't have to handle cultural differences in date and time formats. [!code-csharp[System.DateTime.Persistence#4](~/samples/snippets/csharp/System.DateTime/Persistence.cs#4)][!code-csharp[System.DateTime.Persistence#4](~/samples/snippets/csharp/System.DateTime/Persistence.cs#4)] [!code-vb[System.DateTime.Persistence#4](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/System.DateTime/Persistence.vb#4)] 上述範例未包含時間資訊。The previous example doesn't include time information. 如果值代表時間點，並以本地時間表示之前, 將它轉換從本地時間到 UTC 序列化藉由呼叫方法。If a value represents a moment in time and is expressed as a local time, convert it from local time to UTC before serializing it by calling the method. 將它還原序列化之後，將它從轉換 UTC 到本地時間藉由呼叫方法。After you deserialize it, convert it from UTC to local time by calling the method. 下列範例會使用類別來序列化在美國太平洋時區系統上的資料太平洋標準時間區域，並將它在美國太平洋時區系統上還原序列化管理中心的標準區域。The following example uses the class to serialize data on a system in the U.S. Pacific Standard Time zone and to deserialize it on a system in the U.S. Central Standard zone. [!code-csharp[System.DateTime.Persistence#5](~/samples/snippets/csharp/System.DateTime/Persistence.cs#5)][!code-csharp[System.DateTime.Persistence#5](~/samples/snippets/csharp/System.DateTime/Persistence.cs#5)] [!code-vb[System.DateTime.Persistence#5](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/System.DateTime/Persistence.vb#5)] #### 序列化的日期時間和時區的資料Serializing DateTime and time zone data 先前的範例全都假設值會表示為當地時間。The previous examples all assumed that values are expressed as local times. 程式碼轉換 UTC 與本地時間之間的值，所以它們反映在來源和目標系統上的相同時間點。The code converted the values between UTC and local time so they reflect the same moment in time on the source and target systems. 值可能也會反映在 local 以外的時區與 UTC 時間。 values may also reflect moments in time in a time zone other than local and UTC. 因為結構不是時區感知，您必須同時序列化值和代表時區的物件。Because the structure is not time zone-aware, you have to serialize both the value and the object that represents its time zone. 建立的類型，其欄位同時包含值和時區。Create a type whose fields include both the value and its time zone. 下列範例會定義`DateWithTimeZone`結構。The following example defines a `DateWithTimeZone` structure. [!code-csharp[System.DateTime.Persistence#6](~/samples/snippets/csharp/System.DateTime/DateWithTimeZone.cs#6)][!code-csharp[System.DateTime.Persistence#6](~/samples/snippets/csharp/System.DateTime/DateWithTimeZone.cs#6)] [!code-vb[System.DateTime.Persistence#6](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/System.DateTime/DateWithTimeZone.vb#6)] > [!IMPORTANT] > `DateWithTimeZone`結構用於下面兩個範例，可以序列化和還原序列化的陣列`DateWithTimeZone`物件。The `DateWithTimeZone` structure is used in the next two examples, which serialize and deserialize an array of `DateWithTimeZone` objects. 您可以檢視完整的範例，在此文件的來源在[Visual Basic](https://github.com/dotnet/samples/tree/master/snippets/visualbasic/System.DateTime/)或[C#](https://github.com/dotnet/samples/tree/master/snippets/csharp/System.DateTime/)從 GitHub 上的文件儲存機制。You can view the source for the entire set of examples from this article in either [Visual Basic](https://github.com/dotnet/samples/tree/master/snippets/visualbasic/System.DateTime/) or [C#](https://github.com/dotnet/samples/tree/master/snippets/csharp/System.DateTime/) from the docs repository on GitHub. 使用`DateWithTimeZone`結構，您可以再保存日期和時間以及時區資訊。By using the `DateWithTimeZone` structure, you can then persist date and time along with time zone information. 下列範例會使用類別來序列化的陣列`DateWithTimeZone`物件。The following example uses the class to serialize an array of `DateWithTimeZone` objects. [!code-csharp[System.DateTime.Persistence#7](~/samples/snippets/csharp/System.DateTime/Persistence.cs#7)] [!code-vb[System.DateTime.Persistence#7](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/System.DateTime/Persistence.vb#7)] 下列範例會接著呼叫方法來加以還原序列化。The following example then calls the method to deserialize it. [!code-csharp[System.DateTime.Persistence#8](~/samples/snippets/csharp/System.DateTime/Persistence.cs#8)] [!code-vb[System.DateTime.Persistence#8](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/System.DateTime/Persistence.vb#8)] ### DateTime vs。TimeSpanDateTime vs. TimeSpan 和實值型別的差別在於表示時間的瞬間而表示時間間隔。The and value types differ in that a represents an instant in time whereas a represents a time interval. 您可以將一個執行個體減去從另一個取得物件，表示它們之間的時間間隔。You can subtract one instance of from another to obtain a object that represents the time interval between them. 或者您可以增加正目前取得表示未來的日期值。Or you could add a positive to the current to obtain a value that represents a future date. 您可以加入或減去的時間間隔物件。You can add or subtract a time interval from a object. 時間間隔可以是負數或正數，並以刻度為單位，例如單位來表示秒，或為物件。Time intervals can be negative or positive, and they can be expressed in units such as ticks, seconds, or as a object. ### 在容許範圍內的相等比較Comparing for equality within tolerance 相等比較的並精確的值。Equality comparisons for values are exact. 這表示兩個值必須以相同數目的刻度，才會被視為相等。That means two values must be expressed as the same number of ticks to be considered equal. 有效位數通常是不必要或甚至不正確，對於許多應用程式。That precision is often unecessary or even incorrect for many applications. 通常，您要測試是否物件**大約等於**。Often, you want to test if objects are **roughly equal**. 下列範例示範如何比較大致相等。The following example demonstrates how to compare roughly equivalent . 宣告它們相等時，它會接受差異小邊界。It accepts a small margin of difference when declaring them equal. [!code-csharp[System.DateTime.Comparisons#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/System.DateTime/DateTimeComparisons.cs#1)][!code-csharp[System.DateTime.Comparisons#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/System.DateTime/DateTimeComparisons.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.DateTime.Comparisons#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/System.DateTime/DateTimeComparisons.vb#1)] ### COM interop 的考量COM interop considerations A轉移到 COM 應用程式，然後傳送到受管理的應用程式中，值稱為往返。A value that is transferred to a COM application, then is transferred back to a managed application, is said to round-trip. 不過，值，指定的時間並不會如您預期反覆存取。However, a value that specifies only a time does not round-trip as you might expect. 如果您反覆存取只有時間，例如下午 3 」，最後的日期和時間是 1899 年 12 月 30 日西元If you round-trip only a time, such as 3 P.M., the final date and time is December 30, 1899 C.E. 下午 3:00，而不是 年 1 月 1日日公元 0001at 3:00 P.M., instead of January, 1, 0001 C.E. 在下午 3:00at 3:00 P.M. .NET Framework 和 COM 假設預設的日期時指定的時間。The .NET Framework and COM assume a default date when only a time is specified. 不過，COM 系統會假設 1899 年 12 月 30 日西元，基底日期時.NET Framework 假設基底日期的年 1 月 1 日公元 0001However, the COM system assumes a base date of December 30, 1899 C.E., while the .NET Framework assumes a base date of January, 1, 0001 C.E. 當只有時間從.NET Framework 傳遞至 COM 時，特殊的處理會執行，將時間轉換成 COM 所使用的格式When only a time is passed from the .NET Framework to COM, special processing is performed that converts the time to the format used by COM. 當只有一次從 COM 傳遞至.NET Framework 時，合法的日期和時間或 1899 年 12 月 30 日之前會損毀，因為不執行任何特殊處理。When only a time is passed from COM to the .NET Framework, no special processing is performed because that would corrupt legitimate dates and times on or before December 30, 1899. 如果日期開始其來回從 COM，.NET Framework 和 COM 會保留日期。If a date starts its round-trip from COM, the .NET Framework and COM preserve the date. .NET Framework 和 COM 的行為表示，如果您的應用程式往返，只指定時間，您的應用程式必須記得來修改或忽略錯誤的日期，從最後物件。The behavior of the .NET Framework and COM means that if your application round-trips a that only specifies a time, your application must remember to modify or ignore the erroneous date from the final object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 為產生的一天時間為午夜 (00: 00:00)。The time of day for the resulting is midnight (00:00:00). 屬性會初始化為 。The property is initialized to . 允許值`year`， `month`，和`day`相依於`calendar`。The allowable values for `year`, `month`, and `day` depend on `calendar`. 如果指定的日期和時間不能表示使用，會擲回例外狀況`calendar`。An exception is thrown if the specified date and time cannot be expressed using `calendar`. 命名空間提供數個行事曆，包括和。The namespace provides several calendars including and . ## Examples 下列範例會呼叫建構函式兩次來具現化兩個值。The following example calls the constructor twice to instantiate two values. 第一次呼叫會具現化值使用物件。The first call instantiates a value by using a object. 因為波斯曆無法指定為文化特性的預設曆法，顯示波斯曆中的日期需要個別呼叫其， ，和方法。Because the Persian calendar cannot be designated as the default calendar for a culture, displaying a date in the Persian calendar requires individual calls to its , , and methods. 建構函式的第二個呼叫會具現化值使用物件。The second call to the constructor instantiates a value by using a object. 此範例會變更目前的文化特性為阿拉伯文 （敘利亞），並且目前文化特性的預設曆法變更為回曆。The example changes the current culture to Arabic (Syria) and changes the current culture's default calendar to the Hijri calendar. 因為阿拉伯回曆是目前的文化特性的預設曆法，方法會使用它來格式化日期。Because Hijri is the current culture's default calendar, the method uses it to format the date. 還原先前目前文化特性 （此案例中是英文 （美國）） 時，方法會使用目前文化特性的預設西曆日期格式。When the previous current culture (which is English (United States) in this case) is restored, the method uses the current culture's default Gregorian calendar to format the date. remarks.format: ## Remarks 允許值`year`， `month`，和`day`參數取決於`calendar`參數。The allowable values for `year`, `month`, and `day` parameters depend on the `calendar` parameter. 如果指定的日期和時間不能表示使用，會擲回例外狀況`calendar`。An exception is thrown if the specified date and time cannot be expressed using `calendar`. 中的日期和時間資料或時區有限的度的可攜性時的重要應用程式，您可以使用對應建構函式。For applications in which portability of date and time data or a limited degree of time zone awareness is important, you can use the corresponding constructor. 命名空間提供數個行事曆，包括和。The namespace provides several calendars including and . ## Examples 下列範例會呼叫建構函式兩次來具現化兩個值。The following example calls the constructor twice to instantiate two values. 第一次呼叫會具現化值使用物件。The first call instantiates a value by using a object. 因為波斯曆無法指定為文化特性的預設曆法，顯示波斯曆中的日期需要個別呼叫其， ，和方法。Because the Persian calendar cannot be designated as the default calendar for a culture, displaying a date in the Persian calendar requires individual calls to its , , and methods. 建構函式的第二個呼叫會具現化值使用物件。The second call to the constructor instantiates a value by using a object. 此範例會變更目前的文化特性為阿拉伯文 （敘利亞），並且目前文化特性的預設曆法變更為回曆。The example changes the current culture to Arabic (Syria) and changes the current culture's default calendar to the Hijri calendar. 因為阿拉伯回曆是目前的文化特性的預設曆法，方法會使用它來格式化日期。Because Hijri is the current culture's default calendar, the method uses it to format the date. 還原先前目前文化特性 （此案例中是英文 （美國）） 時，方法會使用目前文化特性的預設西曆日期格式。When the previous current culture (which is English (United States) in this case) is restored, the method uses the current culture's default Gregorian calendar to format the date. [!code-csharp[System.DateTime.Constructor#9](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.datetime.constructor/cs/ctorexample9.cs#9)] [!code-vb[System.DateTime.Constructor#9](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.datetime.constructor/vb/ctorexample9.vb#9)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 您可以使用方法可在單一作業中加入一種以上的時間間隔 （天、 小時、 分鐘、 秒或毫秒為單位）。You can use the method to add more than one kind of time interval (days, hours, minutes, seconds, or milliseconds) in a single operation. 這個方法的行為是相同的加法運算子。This method's behavior is identical to that of the addition operator. 結構也支援特殊的加法方法 (例如， ，和) 的每個時間間隔。The structure also supports specialized addition methods (such as , , and ) for each time interval. 方法會將帳戶潤年和月，當執行日期算術中的天數。The method takes into account leap years and the number of days in a month when performing date arithmetic. 這個方法不會變更這個值。This method does not change the value of this . 相反地，它會傳回新其實此作業的結果。Instead, it returns a new whose value is the result of this operation. 屬性的新執行個體是目前的執行個體相同。The property of the new instance is the same as that of the current instance. ## Examples 下列範例會示範方法。The following example demonstrates the method. 它會計算為從目前的 36 天 （864 小時） 的一週天數。It calculates the day of the week that is 36 days (864 hours) from this moment. remarks.format: ## Remarks 這個方法不會變更這個值。This method does not change the value of this . 相反地，它會傳回新其實此作業的結果。Instead, it returns a new whose value is the result of this operation. 屬性傳回之物件是屬於相同`value`。The property of the returned object is the same as that of `value`. 小數點後的部分`value`是一小時的小數部分。The fractional part of `value` is the fractional part of an hour. 例如，4.5 是相當於 4 小時 30 分鐘，0 秒，0 毫秒為單位，0 刻度。For example, 4.5 is equivalent to 4 hours, 30 minutes, 0 seconds, 0 milliseconds, and 0 ticks. `value`參數四捨五入至最接近的毫秒數。The `value` parameter is rounded to the nearest millisecond. 將轉換為小數少於一小時的時間間隔可能會涉及遺失有效位數，如果結果為非終止重複十進位數。Converting time intervals of less than an hour to a fraction can involve a loss of precision if the result is a non-terminating repeating decimal. （例如，一分鐘是一小時的 0.016667）。若這確為問題，您可以使用方法，它可讓您在單一方法呼叫中指定一種以上的時間間隔，並不需要轉換成小數部分，一小時的時間間隔。(For example, one minute is 0.016667 of an hour.) If this is problematic, you can use the method, which enables you to specify more than one kind of time interval in a single method call and eliminates the need to convert time intervals to fractional parts of an hour. ## Examples 下列範例會使用方法，將日期和時間的整數和小數的值數目。The following example uses the method to add a number of whole and fractional values to a date and time. 它也會說明如何藉由傳遞方法包含小數部分的值導致精確度遺失。It also illustrates the loss of precision caused by passing the method a value that includes a fractional component. remarks.format: ## Remarks 這個方法不會變更這個值物件。This method does not change the value of this object. 相反地，它會傳回新物件，其值為這個作業的結果。Instead, it returns a new object whose value is the result of this operation. 方法會計算產生的年份閏年列入考量。The method calculates the resulting year taking into account leap years. 產生的月份和日期時間部分維持與這個執行個體相同的物件。The month and time-of-day part of the resulting object remains the same as this instance. 如果目前的執行個體代表閏年閏日，則傳回值會取決於目標日期：If the current instance represents the leap day in a leap year, the return value depends on the target date: - 如果`value` + 也為閏年，傳回值表示該年度的閏日。If `value` + is also a leap year, the return value represents the leap day in that year. 例如，如果在 2012 年 2 月 29 日加入四年傳回的日期是 2016 年 2 月 29 日。For example, if four years is added to February 29, 2012, the date returned is February 29, 2016. - 如果`value` + 不為閏年，傳回值表示該年度的閏天前一天。If `value` + is not a leap year, the return value represents the day before the leap day in that year. 例如，如果在 2012 年 2 月 29 日一年加入傳回的日期是 2013 年 2 月 28 日。For example, if one year is added to February 29, 2012, the date returned is February 28, 2013. 下列範例說明如何使用方法代表閏年的一天的值。The following example illustrates using the method with a value that represents a leap year day. 它會顯示日期早於 15 的年和遵循 15 年 2000 年 2 月 29 日。It displays the date for the fifteen years prior to and the fifteen years that follow February 29, 2000. param.name: dateData

summary.span: 還原序列化 64 位元的二進位值，並重新建立原始的序列化 物件。

span.span: Deserializes a 64-bit binary value and recreates an original serialized object.

returns.span: 物件，與 方法所序列化的 物件相等。

span.span: An object that is equivalent to the object that was serialized by the method.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 使用方法，將目前值轉換二進位值的物件。Use the method to convert the value of the current object to a binary value. 接著，使用二進位值和方法來重新建立原始物件。Subsequently, use the binary value and the method to recreate the original object. > [!IMPORTANT] > 在某些情況下，所傳回的值方法不是與相同原始值提供給方法。In some cases, the value returned by the method is not identical to the original value supplied to the method. 如需詳細資訊，請參閱下節中，「 本機時間調整 」。For more information, see the next section, "Local Time Adjustment". ## 本機時間調整Local Time Adjustment 本地時間、 國際標準時間調整，以當地時區，由結構其屬性具有值。A local time, which is a Coordinated Universal Time adjusted to the local time zone, is represented by a structure whose property has the value . 還原本機時值所產生的二進位表示法方法，方法可能會調整重建後的值，使不等於原始值。When restoring a local value from the binary representation that is produced by the method, the method may adjust the recreated value so that it is not equal to the original value. 在下列狀況下可能會發生這種情形：This can occur under the following conditions: - 如果本機物件由一個時區中序列化方法，然後在不同的時區，由還原序列化和方法，表示所產生的本機時間物件會自動調整第二個時區中。If a local object is serialized in one time zone by the method, and then deserialized in a different time zone by the method, the local time represented by the resulting object is automatically adjusted to the second time zone. 例如，請考慮物件，代表本地時間為下午 3。For example, consider a object that represents a local time of 3 P.M. 在美國太平洋時區中執行的應用程式太平洋時區使用方法，以將其轉換二進位值的物件。An application that is executing in the U.S. Pacific Time zone uses the method to convert that object to a binary value. 在美國太平洋時區中執行的另一個應用程式接著會使用美國東部時區方法，將二進位值，轉換至新物件。Another application that is executing in the U.S. Eastern Time zone then uses the method to convert the binary value to a new object. 新的值物件是下午 6 點，以時間為原始的下午 3 代表相同的點The value of the new object is 6 P.M., which represents the same point in time as the original 3 P.M. 值，但會以美國東部時區為準的當地時間調整。value, but is adjusted to local time in the Eastern Time zone. - 如果在本機的二進位表示法值代表本地時區系統上的時間無效是呼叫，時間會調整，以便有效。If the binary representation of a local value represents an invalid time in the local time zone of the system on which is called, the time is adjusted so that it is valid. 比方說，從標準時間到日光節約時間轉換發生的美國太平洋時區中在 2010 年 3 月 14 日的上午 2:00，時間推進到上午 3:00 的一小時For example, the transition from standard time to daylight saving time occurs in the Pacific Time zone of the United States on March 14, 2010, at 2:00 A.M., when the time advances by one hour, to 3:00 A.M. 這個小時間隔內會是無效的時間，也就是不存在於這個時區的時間間隔。This hour interval is an invalid time, that is, a time interval that does not exist in this time zone. 下列範例顯示時的時間之內這個範圍會轉換為二進位值的方法，然後還原成為有效的時間會調整的方法，將原始值。The following example shows that when a time that falls within this range is converted to a binary value by the method and is then restored by the method, the original value is adjusted to become a valid time. 您可以判斷是否是特定日期和時間值可能會受限於修改傳遞至方法，為此範例會說明。You can determine whether a particular date and time value may be subject to modification by passing it to the method, as the example illustrates. [!code-csharp[System.DateTime.FromBinary#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.datetime.frombinary/cs/frombinary1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.DateTime.FromBinary#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.datetime.frombinary/vb/frombinary1.vb#1)] ## 版本的考量Version Considerations 以.NET Framework 2.0 版中，啟動結構所組成的私用的類型欄位，指出是否在指定的時間本地時間、 國際標準時間 (UTC) 或兩者皆否，串連的私用的刻度欄位，其中包含指定的日期和時間的 100 奈秒刻度數目。Starting with the .NET Framework version 2.0, a structure consists of a private Kind field, which indicates whether the specified time is local time, Coordinated Universal Time (UTC), or neither, concatenated to a private Ticks field, which contains the number of 100-nanosecond ticks that specify a date and time. 使用可以存取的刻度數使用可以存取的屬性和 theKind 欄位屬性。The number of ticks can be accessed with the property and theKind field can be accessed with the property. 在.NET Framework 2.0，如果您序列化之前物件手動而不是使用序列化介面，例如，序列化的刻度資料中您所需。Prior to the .NET Framework 2.0, if you serialized a object manually instead of using a serialization interface such as , you needed to serialize only the Ticks data in the . 從.NET Framework 2.0 開始，您也必須序列化類型的資料。Starting with the .NET Framework 2.0, you must also serialize the Kind data.

span.span: is less than or greater than .

remarks.format: ## Remarks Windows 檔案時間是 64 位元值，表示 12:00，年 1 月 1 西元 1601年日午夜起已經過的 100 奈秒間隔數A Windows file time is a 64-bit value that represents the number of 100-nanosecond intervals that have elapsed since 12:00 midnight, January 1, 1601 A.D. (C.E.)國際標準時間 (UTC)。(C.E.) Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). Windows 用來記錄應用程式建立、 存取，或寫入檔案時的檔案時間。Windows uses a file time to record when an application creates, accesses, or writes to a file. `fileTime`參數指定的檔案時間以 100 奈秒刻度表示。The `fileTime` parameter specifies a file time expressed in 100-nanosecond ticks. 從.NET Framework 2.0 版開始，傳回值是其屬性是。Starting with the .NET Framework version 2.0, the return value is a whose property is . ## Examples 下列範例會示範方法。The following example demonstrates the method. [!code-cpp[DateTime.FromFileTime#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR/DateTime.FromFileTime/CPP/class1.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[DateTime.FromFileTime#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR/DateTime.FromFileTime/CS/class1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[DateTime.FromFileTime#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR/DateTime.FromFileTime/VB/class1.vb#1)]

exception.span: 小於 0，或表示大於 的時間。

span.span: is less than 0 or represents a time greater than .

block.para:
一般情況下，方法還原所儲存的值方法。Ordinarily, the method restores a value that was saved by the method. 不過，在下列情況下的兩個值可能與不同：However, the two values may differ under the following conditions:
- 如果序列化和還原序列化值偏高，在不同時區。If the serialization and deserialization of the value occur in different time zones. 例如，如果時間為下午 12:30 的值For example, if a value with a time of 12:30 P.M. 在美國太平洋時區美加東部時區是序列化的而且在美國太平洋時區然後還原序列化太平洋時區，下午 12:30 的原始值in the U.S. Eastern Time zone is serialized, and then deserialized in the U.S. Pacific Time zone, the original value of 12:30 P.M. 會調整為上午 9:30is adjusted to 9:30 A.M. 以反映兩個時區之間的差異。to reflect the difference between the two time zones.
- 如果序列化的值代表本地時區中無效的時間。If the value that is serialized represents an invalid time in the local time zone. 在此情況下，方法調整還原值，使其以當地時區表示有效的時間。In this case, the method adjusts the restored value so that it represents a valid time in the local time zone.
例如，從標準時間轉換到日光節約時間發生在美國太平洋時區太平洋時區在 2010 年 3 月 14 日到上午 2:00，時間推進到上午 3:00 的一小時For example, the transition from standard time to daylight saving time occurs in the U.S. Pacific Time zone on March 14, 2010, at 2:00 A.M., when the time advances by one hour, to 3:00 A.M. 這個小時間隔內會是無效的時間，也就是不存在於這個時區的時間間隔。This hour interval is an invalid time, that is, a time interval that does not exist in this time zone. 下列範例顯示時間的年份時的長整數值轉換此範圍方法，然後還原成為有效的時間會調整的方法，將原始值。The following example shows that when a time that falls within this range is converted to a long integer value by the method and is then restored by the method, the original value is adjusted to become a valid time. 您可以判斷是否是特定日期和時間值可能會受限於修改傳遞至方法，為此範例會說明。You can determine whether a particular date and time value may be subject to modification by passing it to the method, as the example illustrates.

public: static DateTime FromOADate(double d);

span.span: An OLE Automation Date value.

summary.span: 傳回等於指定 OLE Automation 日期的 。

span.span: Returns a equivalent to the specified OLE Automation Date.

returns.span: 物件，表示和 相同的日期和時間。

span.span: An object that represents the same date and time as .

remarks.format: ## Remarks `d`參數是代表日期做為基底日期前後，午夜，30 1899 年的日數的雙精確度浮點數。The `d` parameter is a double-precision floating-point number that represents a date as the number of days before or after the base date, midnight, 30 December 1899. 符號和整數類資料類型屬於`d`編碼日期做為正或負一天加上的位移，從 1899 年 30，以及小數部分的絕對值`d`編碼為一天加上位移，從午夜一部分的一天時間。The sign and integral part of `d` encode the date as a positive or negative day displacement from 30 December 1899, and the absolute value of the fractional part of `d` encodes the time of day as a fraction of a day displacement from midnight. `d` 必須是正數 2958465.99999999 透過負數 657435.0 之間的值。`d` must be a value between negative 657435.0 through positive 2958465.99999999. 請注意，由於日期編碼的方式，有兩種代表 30 1899 年當天任何時間。Note that because of the way dates are encoded, there are two ways of representing any time of day on 30 December 1899. 例如，-0.5，0.5 表示中午 30 1899 年，因為日期加上位移的加號或減號基底日期則從零天仍然是基底的日期，而且從午夜的半天位移中午。For example, -0.5 and 0.5 both mean noon on 30 December 1899 because a day displacement of plus or minus zero days from the base date is still the base date, and a half day displacement from midnight is noon. 請參閱如需有關 OLE Automation。See for more information on OLE Automation.

exception.span: 日期不是有效的 OLE Automation 日期值。

span.span: The date is not a valid OLE Automation Date value.

summary.span: 將這個執行個體的值轉換為標準日期和時間格式規範所支援的所有字串表示。

span.span: Converts the value of this instance to all the string representations supported by the standard date and time format specifiers.

remarks.format: ## Remarks > [!IMPORTANT] > 您不應該假設多個呼叫多載會傳回相同的資料。You should not assume that multiple calls to the overloads will return identical data. 根據特定多載中，如果目前的文化特性變更，使用者會覆寫個別的文化特性設定，或系統的文化特性的資料，就會更新，可以變更這個方法所傳回的資料。Depending on the specific overload, the data returned by this method can change if the current culture changes, the user overrides individual cultural settings, or an update occurs to the system's cultural data.

span.span: Converts the value of this instance to all the string representations supported by the standard date and time format specifiers.

span.span: A string array where each element is the representation of the value of this instance formatted with one of the standard date and time format specifiers.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 所傳回的字串陣列方法相當於結合個別呼叫所傳回的字串陣列具有"d"、"D"、"f"、"F"、"g"、"G"、"m"、"o"、"r"、"s"、"t"、"T"、"u"、"U"和"y"標準格式字串的方法。The string array returned by the method is equivalent to combining the string arrays returned by separate calls to the method with the "d", "D", "f", "F", "g", "G", "m", "o", "r", "s", "t", "T", "u", "U", and "y" standard format strings. 如需標準格式規範的詳細資訊，請參閱[標準日期和時間格式字串](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-date-and-time-format-strings.md)。For more information about standard format specifiers, see [Standard Date and Time Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-date-and-time-format-strings.md). 傳回值的每個項目會格式化為使用目前文化特性的資訊。Each element of the return value is formatted using information from the current culture. 如需目前的文化特性的文化特性格式資訊的詳細資訊，請參閱。For more information about culture-specific formatting information for the current culture, see . > [!IMPORTANT] > 這個方法會使用區分文化特性的資料，因為您不應該假設該方法的多個呼叫會傳回相同的資料。Because this method uses culture-sensitive data, you should not assume that multiple calls to the method will return identical data. 如果目前的文化特性變更，使用者會覆寫個別的文化特性設定，或系統的文化特性的資料，就會更新，可以變更這個方法所傳回的資料。The data returned by this method can change if the current culture changes, the user overrides individual cultural settings, or an update occurs to the system's cultural data. ## Examples 下列範例會示範方法。The following example demonstrates the method. 它會顯示電腦的目前文化特性中，在此案例中是 EN-US 使用所有可能的標準日期和時間格式的日期的字串表示。It displays the string representation of a date using all possible standard date and time formats in the computer's current culture, which in this case is en-US. param.span: 標準日期和時間格式字串。

span.span: A standard date and time format string.

summary.span: 將這個執行個體的值轉換為指定的標準日期和時間格式規範所支援的所有字串表示。

span.span: Converts the value of this instance to all the string representations supported by the specified standard date and time format specifier.

remarks.format: ## Remarks `format`參數可以是任何一個標準日期和時間格式規範。The `format` parameter can be any of the standard date and time format specifiers. 這些包括 d、 D、 f、 F、 g、 G、 M （或 m），O （或 o），R （或 r） s、 t、 T、 u、 U 和 Y （或 y）。These include d, D, f, F, g, G, M (or m), O (or o), R (or r), s, t, T, u, U, and Y (or y). 如需詳細資訊，請參閱[標準日期和時間格式字串](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-date-and-time-format-strings.md)。For more information, see [Standard Date and Time Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-date-and-time-format-strings.md). 傳回值的每個項目會格式化為使用目前文化特性的資訊。Each element of the return value is formatted using information from the current culture. 如需目前的文化特性的文化特性格式資訊的詳細資訊，請參閱。For more information about culture-specific formatting information for the current culture, see . > [!IMPORTANT] > 這個方法會使用區分文化特性的資料，因為您不應該假設該方法的多個呼叫會傳回相同的資料。Because this method uses culture-sensitive data, you should not assume that multiple calls to the method will return identical data. 如果目前的文化特性變更，使用者會覆寫個別的文化特性設定，或系統的文化特性的資料，就會更新，可以變更這個方法所傳回的資料。The data returned by this method can change if the current culture changes, the user overrides individual cultural settings, or an update occurs to the system's cultural data. ## Examples 下列範例會示範方法。The following example demonstrates the method. 它會顯示完整日期格式規範 ("D") 會使用目前文化特性的日期的字串表示。It displays the string representation of a date using the long date format specifier ("D") for the current culture. summary.span: 指出這個 執行個體是否在目前時區的日光節約時間範圍內。

span.span: Indicates whether this instance of is within the daylight saving time range for the current time zone.

returns.span: 當 屬性的值為 或 ，且這個 執行個體的值位於當地時區的日光節約時間範圍內時為 ；當 是 時為 。

span.span: if the value of the property is or and the value of this instance of is within the daylight saving time range for the local time zone; if is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 這個方法會判斷是否目前值落在日光節約時間範圍內的當地時區，這由屬性。This method determines whether the current value falls within the daylight saving time range of the local time zone, which is returned by the property. 您可以判斷是否時區支援日光節約時間擷取的值及其屬性。You can determine whether a time zone supports daylight saving time by retrieving the value of its property. 觀察日光節約時間的時區，您可以判斷所擷取的日光節約時間的來回轉換發生時時區所傳回的陣列屬性。For time zones that observe daylight saving time, you can determine when the transition to and from daylight saving time occurs by retrieving the array returned by the time zone's property. 如果目前值代表本地時區的模稜兩可或無效的時間，則方法會傳回`false`。If the current value represents either an ambiguous or an invalid time in the local time zone, the method returns `false`. 在[!INCLUDE[winxp](~/includes/winxp-md.md)]系統方法會判斷目前的執行個體是否日光節約時間時，會辨識只在目前的調整規則。On [!INCLUDE[winxp](~/includes/winxp-md.md)] systems, the method recognizes only the current adjustment rule when determining whether the current instance is a daylight saving time. 如此一來，此方法可能不正確地回報目前的執行個體是否為目前的調整規則生效之前的時間日光節約時間。As a result, the method may not accurately report whether the current instance is a daylight saving time for periods before the current adjustment rule came into effect.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 這個常數的值相當於 23:59:59.9999999 UTC，年 12 月 31 日西曆，只有一個 100 奈秒刻度之前 00:00:00 UTC，10000 年 1 月 1 日到 9999。The value of this constant is equivalent to 23:59:59.9999999 UTC, December 31, 9999 in the Gregorian calendar, exactly one 100-nanosecond tick before 00:00:00 UTC, January 1, 10000. 部分月曆，例如，支援早於上方的日期範圍。Some calendars, such as the , support an upper date range that is earlier than . 在這些情況下，嘗試存取指派變數或格式化和剖析作業可能會擲回。In these cases, trying to access in variable assignments or formatting and parsing operations can throw an . 而擷取的值不是，您可以擷取從指定的文化特性最有效的日期值的屬性。Rather than retrieving the value of , you can retrieve the value of the specified culture's latest valid date value from the property. ## Examples 下列範例會具現化物件，並傳遞其建構函式值代表微秒刻度數。The following example instantiates a object by passing its constructor an value that represents a number of ticks. 叫用之前建構函式，範例會確保此值是大於或等於`DateTime.MinValue.Ticks`且小於或等於`DateTime.MaxValue.Ticks`。Before invoking the constructor, the example ensures that this value is greater than or equal to `DateTime.MinValue.Ticks` and less than or equal to `DateTime.MaxValue.Ticks`. 如果沒有，就會擲回。If not, it throws an . remarks.format: ## Remarks 您可以顯示的字串表示"fff"格式規範的屬性。You can display the string representation of the property by using the "fff" format specifier. 例如，下列程式碼會顯示日期和時間，在主控台中包含的毫秒數的字串。For example, the following code displays a string that contains the number of milliseconds in a date and time to the console. [!code-csharp[System.DateTime.Millisecond#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.DateTime.Millisecond/cs/Millisecond.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.DateTime.Millisecond#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.DateTime.Millisecond/vb/Millisecond.vb#1)] 您也可以使用"o"標準格式規範來顯示毫秒數元件，以及日期和時間值的其他元件。You can also display the millisecond component together with the other components of a date and time value by using the "o" standard format specifier. 例如: For example: [!code-csharp[System.DateTime.Millisecond#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.DateTime.Millisecond/cs/Millisecond.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.DateTime.Millisecond#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.DateTime.Millisecond/vb/Millisecond.vb#2)] 不過，"o"格式規範是較少往返或儲存顯示比值。However, the "o" format specifier is intended less for displaying than for round-tripping or storing a value. 您也可以使用自訂格式字串，如下列範例所示，以顯示毫秒為單位，以及其他的日期和時間元件。You can also display milliseconds together with other date and time components by using a custom format string, as the following example shows. [!code-csharp[System.DateTime.Millisecond#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.DateTime.Millisecond/cs/Millisecond.cs#3)] [!code-vb[System.DateTime.Millisecond#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.DateTime.Millisecond/vb/Millisecond.vb#3)] ## Examples 下列範例會示範屬性。The following example demonstrates the property. remarks.format: ## Remarks 這個常數的值相當於 00:00:00.0000000 UTC，年 1 月 1 日 0001 西曆。The value of this constant is equivalent to 00:00:00.0000000 UTC, January 1, 0001, in the Gregorian calendar. 定義日期和時間所指派到未初始化變數。 defines the date and time that is assigned to an uninitialized variable. 下列範例將說明這點。The following example illustrates this. remarks.format: ## Remarks 屬性會傳回值，表示目前的日期和時間在本機電腦上的。The property returns a value that represents the current date and time on the local computer. 請注意會有差異值，表示 0001 年 1 月 1 日午夜起已經過的刻度數的字串表示法，該表示的日期和時間值中的值特定的特定文化特性的格式。Note that there is a difference between a value, which represents the number of ticks that have elapsed since midnight of January 1, 0001, and the string representation of that value, which expresses a date and time value in a culture-specific-specific format. 如需格式的日期和時間值的資訊，請參閱方法。For information on formatting date and time values, see the method. 下列範例會顯示簡短日期和時間字串中的特定文化特性格式數字。The following example displays the short date and time string in a number of culture-specific formats. [!code-cpp[System.DateTime.Now#2](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.datetime.now/cpp/now1.cpp#2)] [!code-csharp[System.DateTime.Now#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.datetime.now/cs/now1.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.DateTime.Now#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.datetime.now/vb/now1.vb#2)] 這個屬性的解析取決於系統計時器，取決於基礎作業系統。The resolution of this property depends on the system timer, which depends on the underlying operating system. 它通常會以 0.5 和 15 毫秒之間。It tends to be between 0.5 and 15 milliseconds. 如此一來，重複呼叫在短時間間隔內，例如迴圈、 內嵌的屬性可能會傳回相同的值。As a result, repeated calls to the property in a short time interval, such as in a loop, may return the same value. 屬性經常用來測量效能。The property is frequently used to measure performance. 不過，由於其低的解析度不適合作為效能評定工具。However, because of its low resolution, it is not suitable for use as a benchmarking tool. 較佳替代方式是使用類別。A better alternative is to use the class. 從.NET Framework 2.0 版開始，傳回值是其屬性會傳回。Starting with the .NET Framework version 2.0, the return value is a whose property returns . > [!NOTE] > 您也可以使用屬性，以擷取目前的本地日期和時間。You can also use the property to retrieve the current local date and time. 它可讓以明確表示為單一點的時間，接著該時間使值成為可攜式跨電腦的本地時間。It allows a local time to be expressed unambiguously as a single point in time, which in turn makes that time value portable across computers. ## Examples 下列範例會使用和屬性，以擷取目前的本地日期和時間和目前的通用協調 (UTC) 日期和時間。The following example uses the and properties to retrieve the current local date and time and the current universal coordinated (UTC) date and time. 接著會使用數字的文化特性的格式設定慣例的值，以及顯示字串，其屬性。It then uses the formatting conventions of a number of cultures to display the strings, along with the values of the their properties. [!code-cpp[System.DateTime.Now#3](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.datetime.now/cpp/now2.cpp#3)] [!code-csharp[System.DateTime.Now#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.datetime.now/cs/now2.cs#3)] [!code-vb[System.DateTime.Now#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.datetime.now/vb/now2.vb#3)]

方法嘗試之日期和時間值的字串表示轉換成其相等。The method tries to convert the string representation of a date and time value to its equivalent. 它會嘗試將輸入的字串完全剖析而不擲回例外狀況。It tries to parse the input string completely without throwing a exception. > [!IMPORTANT] > 如果在剖析作業失敗，因為無法辨識的字串格式，所以方法會擲回，而方法會傳回`false`。If the parsing operation fails because of an unrecognized string format, the method throws a , whereas the method returns `false`. 由於例外狀況處理可能會耗費資源，您應使用當預期在剖析作業成功，因為輸入的來源是受信任。Because exception handling can be expensive, you should use when the parsing operation is expected to succeed because the input source is trusted. 何時可能會剖析失敗，因為輸入的來源不受信任，或您有合理的預設值來替代字串時，不會被剖析成功，則會偏好。 is preferable when parsing failures are likely, particularly because an input source is not trusted, or you have reasonable default values to substitute for strings that do not parse successfully. 要剖析的字串可以採用任何下列形式：The string to be parsed can take any of the following forms: - 字串，含有日期和時間元件。A string with a date and a time component. - 含日期，但沒有時間部分的字串。A string with a date but no time component. 如果時間元件不存在，則方法會假設午夜 12:00。If the time component is absent, the method assumes 12:00 midnight. 如果日期元件有兩位數年份，則會轉換為根據的年份目前文化特性的現行曆法或指定的文化特性的現行曆法的 (如果您使用多載具有非 null`provider`引數)。If the date component has a two-digit year, it is converted to a year based on the of the current culture's current calendar or the specified culture's current calendar (if you use an overload with a non-null `provider` argument). - 字串，包含只月份和年份的日期元件，但沒有日期元件。A string with a date component that includes only the month and the year but no day component. 方法會假設每月的第一天。The method assumes the first day of the month. - 字串，包含只月和日的日期元件，但沒有年元件。A string with a date component that includes only the month and the day but no year component. 方法會假設目前的年份。The method assumes the current year. - 具有一次，但沒有日期元件的字串。A string with a time but no date component. 方法會假設目前的日期，除非您呼叫多載，並包含中`styles`引數，在其中案例方法假設年 1 月 1 日 0001。The method assumes the current date unless you call the overload and include in the `styles` argument, in which case the method assumes a date of January 1, 0001. - 具有時間元件，其中包含在一小時和 AM/PM 指示項，與沒有日期元件的字串。A string with a time component that includes only the hour and an AM/PM designator, with no date component. 方法會假設目前的日期和時間不分鐘和不含秒數。The method assumes the current date and a time with no minutes and no seconds. 您可以變更此行為，藉由呼叫多載，並包含中`styles`引數，在其中案例方法假設年 1 月 1 日 0001。You can change this behavior by calling the overload and include in the `styles` argument, in which case the method assumes a date of January 1, 0001. - 字串，包含時區資訊，並符合 ISO 8601 標準。A string that includes time zone information and conforms to ISO 8601. 在下列範例中，第一個字串代表國際標準時間 (UTC)，而第二個指定為七個小時的時區的時間早於 UTC:In the following examples, the first string designates Coordinated Universal Time (UTC), and the second designates the time in a time zone that's seven hours earlier than UTC: "2008-11-01T19:35:00.0000000Z""2008-11-01T19:35:00.0000000Z" "2008-11-01T19:35:00.0000000-07:00""2008-11-01T19:35:00.0000000-07:00" - 字串，包含 GMT 指示項，並符合 RFC 1123 時間格式。例如：A string that includes the GMT designator and conforms to the RFC 1123 time format; for example: 「 2008 年 11 月 01 年，星期六格林威治時間 19:35:00""Sat, 01 Nov 2008 19:35:00 GMT" - 字串，其中包含的日期和時間以及時區位移資訊。例如：A string that includes the date and time along with time zone offset information; for example: represents a culture other than the invariant culture can unexpectedly fail if any of the following occurs: > > - .NET Framework 的或現有的.NET framework 版本的更新結果的主要或次要版本之間已經變更的特定文化特性的資料。The remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法剖析字串表示法中所定義的格式必須是日期`format`參數。The method parses the string representation of a date, which must be in the format defined by the `format` parameter. 它也需要\<日期 > 和\<時間 > 日期和時間的字串表示的項目會出現在所指定的順序`format`，而且`s`不有非的允許任何空白字元`format`.It also requires that the \ and \ elements of the string representation of a date and time appear in the order specified by `format`, and that `s` have no white space other than that permitted by `format`. 如果`format`定義日期任何時間元素和剖析作業成功時，所產生的值具有午夜的時間 (00: 00:00)。If `format` defines a date with no time element and the parse operation succeeds, the resulting value has a time of midnight (00:00:00). 如果`format`所定義的時間沒有任何日期項目與剖析作業成功時，所產生的值具有日期`DateTime.Now.Date`。If `format` defines a time with no date element and the parse operation succeeds, the resulting value has a date of `DateTime.Now.Date`. 如果`s`不的代表時間以特定的時區，剖析作業成功，屬性傳回之值是。If `s` does not represent a time in a particular time zone and the parse operation succeeds, the property of the returned value is . 如果`s`代表特定時區的時間和`format`允許必須存在的時區資訊 (例如，如果`format`相當於"o"、"r"或"u"標準格式規範，如果它包含"z"、"zz"或"zzz"自訂格式規範）屬性傳回之值是。If `s` does represent the time in a particular time zone and `format` allows time zone information to be present (for example, if `format` is equal to the "o", "r", or "u" standard format specifiers, or if it contains the "z", "zz", or "zzz" custom format specifiers), the property of the returned value is . `format`參數是包含單一標準格式規範或一或多個自訂格式規範會定義所需的格式字串`s`。The `format` parameter is a string that contains either a single standard format specifier, or one or more custom format specifiers that define the required format of `s`. 如需有效格式的程式碼的詳細資訊，請參閱[標準日期和時間格式字串](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-date-and-time-format-strings.md)或[自訂日期和時間格式字串](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-date-and-time-format-strings.md)。For details about valid formatting codes, see [Standard Date and Time Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-date-and-time-format-strings.md) or [Custom Date and Time Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-date-and-time-format-strings.md). > [!NOTE] > 如果`format`是不包含日期或時間分隔符號 （例如"yyyyMMddHHmm")，使用的文化特性而異的自訂格式模式`provider`參數和寬形式的每個自訂格式規範。If `format` is a custom format pattern that does not include date or time separators (such as "yyyyMMddHHmm"), use the invariant culture for the `provider` parameter and the widest form of each custom format specifier. 例如，如果您想要指定時數的格式模式中，指定寬表單中，"HH"，而不是較窄的表單中，"H"。For example, if you want to specify hours in the format pattern, specify the wider form, "HH", instead of the narrower form, "H". 特定日期和時間符號和字串 （例如一週中特定語言的名稱） 用於`s`會由`provider`參數，因為是精確的格式`s`如果`format`是標準格式規範的字串。The particular date and time symbols and strings (such as names of the days of the week in a particular language) used in `s` are defined by the `provider` parameter, as is the precise format of `s` if `format` is a standard format specifier string. `provider`參數可以是下列任一項：The `provider` parameter can be any of the following: - A物件，代表用來解譯的文化特性`s`。A object that represents the culture used to interpret `s`. 所傳回的物件及其屬性會定義符號與中的格式化`s`。The object returned by its property defines the symbols and formatting in `s`. - A物件，定義日期和時間資料的格式。A object that defines the format of date and time data. - 自訂實作其方法會傳回物件或提供格式設定資訊的物件。A custom implementation whose method returns either the object or the object that provides formatting information. 如果`provider`是`null`、使用對應至目前的文化特性的物件。If `provider` is `null`, the object that corresponds to the current culture is used. ## Examples 下列範例會示範方法。The following example demonstrates the method.
